properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and restricted access arrangements will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year's Eve in Rose Bay and Vaucluse.

From 3pm until 2am the following roads will close. Access for local residents will be maintained by traffic controllers until 6pm only, not access after 6pm unti roads reopen.

  • Rose Bay: roads into Rose Bay from New South Head Rd including Bayview Hill Rd, Caledonian Rd, Collins Ave, Dumaresq Rd and Tivoli Ave. 
  • Vaucluse: roads into Vaucluse from New South Head Rd including Carrara Rd, Hopetoun Ave, Old South Head Rd, Petrarch Ave, Queens Ave, Serpentine Pde. Vaucluse Rd will be closed southbound and remain open for one-way northbound traffic only.

Roads will reopen from 2am or once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm, in some areas access is restricted to all vehicle traffic including residents after such time.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of New South Head Rd in Vaucluse from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

webLinks.linkText: NYE at Parramatta Park
NYE 2025 TfNSW Interactive Road Closure and Clearway map

properties.publicTransport: Trains and buses run regularly to Parramatta within walking distance of the park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Tens of thousands of people are expected to ring in the New Year at the NYE event in Parramatta Park from 5pm to 9.30pm. Fireworks at 9pm. Entry is free and no tickets are required.

Motorists should expect delays throughout Parramatta CBD and surrounding the park, motorists should also exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Road closures:

  • Parramatta Park will be closed to all vehicles from 6am on Wednesday 31 December. There will be no parking inside the Park and a number external parking spaces around the Park will not be available due to event operations.
  • Westmead: Roads close from 4pm to 10pm including parts of Queens Rd, Park Ave, Alfred St, Central Ave and Railway Parade. 
  • Parramatta: Roads close from 8.30pm to 10pm including O'Connell St, George St, Hunter St, Macquarie St, Pitt St and Park Pde.
  • The Parramatta River cycle way between O’Connell Street Bridge and the Parramatta Park weir will be closed from 6am on event day.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will use different routes and stops due to road closures. From 7pm buses will run to and from Gladstone Park in Balmain only. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place this New Year's Eve in Balmain, Rozelle, Birchgrove and Drummoyne in the Balmain Peninsula.

  • From 3pm to 1am road closures will be in place on sections of Darling St, Ballast Point Rd, Booth St, Brent St, Evan St, Grove St, Joseph St, Hartley St, Hanover St, Loughlin St, Mackenzie St, Mansfield St, McKell St, Mullens St, Rose St, Terry St, The Crescent, Waragal Ave, Wharf Rd and Yeend St.
  • There will be no access for general traffic from Victoria Rd into the Balmain Peninsula after 3pm.
  • Access will be permitted for Balmain Access Permit holders only, buses, taxis and other authorised vehicles. NSW Police will be onsite vetting vehicles at closure locations.
  • From 3pm until 7pm, Taxis and rideshare vehicles will be permitted through closures with proof of residence pick up / drop off. From 7pm until 1am, all taxis and rideshare vehicles will not be permitted through closure points.
  • Roads will reopen from 1am on New Year's Day or at the direction of NSW Police when safe to do so. Heavy traffic is expected exiting the area after the midnight fireworks so be patient or delay your travel until after 1am.

Special event clearways will be in effect on Victoria Rd from The Crescent, Rozelle to Westbourne St, Drummoyne (western side) from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD. From 3pm extended no-parking and bus zones will be in effect on sections of Darling St, Eaton St, Grove St and the Crescent, and no-stopping zones will be in effect on sections of Montague St.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.﻿

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

BALMAIN PENINSULA (BALMAIN/BIRCHGROVE/ROZELLE)

The following roads will be closed to all vehicular traffic entering the Balmain peninsula except Transport for NSW (TfNSW), Buses, Taxis, Hire Cars and Balmain Access Permit holders and will be manned by NSW Police officers. Council has liaised with the police to ensure that taxis will be allowed access to the peninsula on New Years Eve. However, taxi access after 7pm will require the passenger to have information verifying that they are a resident of the Balmain peninsula.

For more information on local council closures visit the Inner West Council website.

properties.publicTransport: Transport services will be significantly affected by road closures. Visit transportnsw.info/sydney-nye for all the details you need to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Significant road closures and widespread parking restrictions will be in effect across the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont as hundreds of thousands of people gather at harbour vantage points for the New Year's Eve 9pm and midnight fireworks.

Do not drive on NYE - parking is limited and access to properties and car parks will be restricted. Catch public transport.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES:

  • The Cahill Expressway southbound lanes 7 and 8 on the Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay Overpass will close from 4am on NYE until 6am NYD. The Cahill Walk will also close.
  • Roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks close from 12pm and 2pm, including the Harbour Bridge Grosvenor St off-ramp, use York St instead.
  • Major closures in the city centre and Pyrmont from 5pm and 7pm.
  • From 7pm the only way to travel east/west across the city is via Goulburn St or the Cross City Tunnel. From the Harbour Bridge there will also be no access to Harbour St at Darling Harbour. Use York St or Glebe Off-ramps
  • The Harbour Bridge walkway and cycleway close from 6pm to 2am. CBD cycleways across the city will close when roads close.
  • By 11pm the city is locked down with no vehicle access, only through traffic available via the Cross City Tunnel and Harbour Tunnel
  • The Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions from 11pm until 1.30am. The citybound lanes of the Anzac Bridge, Western Distributor, M4 / M8 citybound tunnels and Iron Cove Link will also be closed from 11pm to 1.30am.
  • Roads start reopening from 1.30am on NYD including the Harbour Bridge, with most roads in the city reopened by 4am.
  • See the interactive map for full details of all the road closure locations and times.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on most roads in the city and Pyrmont from 6am NYE until 4am NYD. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

NYE 2025 TfNSW Interactive Road Closure and Clearway map

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed from 3pm. Buses that usually run to Blue St North Sydney will use stops on Berry St and Miller St near McLaren St. Ferries will not stop at McMahons Point from 10am and Milsons Point from 2pm on NYE. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
With major road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year's Eve attendees should leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Roads along the waterfront in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay and Blues Point start closing the night before on Tuesday 30 December.

On New Year's Eve roads key roads in North Sydney CBD close from 3pm follow by major closures in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and Lavender Bay from 5pm. Roads will reopen by 3am on 1 January.

Key road closure timings:

  • 7pm 30 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: harbourfront roads around vantage points in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and McMahons Point will close including Blues Point Rd, Lavender Cres, Kirribilli Ave, Olympic Dr, Broughton St, Pitt St, Railway Ave and Henry Lawson Ave.
  • 8am 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: sections of Blues Point Rd from French St, Alfred St Sth and local roads surrounding vantage points will close. 
  • 12pm 31 Dec - 3am 1 Jan: Fitzroy St between Alfred St South and Broughton St. Use High St instead.
  • 3pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: Blue St at North Sydney Station and Ennis Rd from Broughton St at Milsons Point Station will close.
  • 5pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: more major roads in North Sydney, McMahons Point, Milsons Point and Waverton including sections of Miller St, Blues Point Rd, Lavender St, Union St, Balls Head Rd, Pacific Hwy southbound, Alfred St South, Walker St, Denison St and surrounding local roads. 
  • From 5pm access to Kirribilli and Milsons Point is via Military Rd only due to the closure of Pacific Hwy southbound.
  • 8pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: the Pacific Hwy northbound off ramp to North Sydney from Sydney Harbour Bridge. Use the Miller St or Military Rd off-ramps instead for access to North Sydney.
  • 11pm – 1.30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge closed in both directions and Western Distributor fully closed between Pyrmont and the city. Arthur St southbound between Berry St and Mount St, all traffic to turn left on to Warringah Fwy northbound.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Kirribilli, Lavender Bay, McMahons Point, Milsons Point and North Sydney between 1pm NYE and 3am NYD. On some streets clearways in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and McMahons Point will be in effect from 6pm 30 Dec.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Symphony Under The Stars

properties.publicTransport: L1 Light rail services run regularly to Exhibition Centre and Paddy's Markets within walking distance of Tumbalong Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Symphony Under The Stars at Tumbalong Park in Darling Harbour. Event starts at 6.30pm, Orchestra performance starts at 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and in Darling Harbour. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Attendees are encouraged to catch public transport.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Sydney FC at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Buses replace trains between Lidcombe and Olympic Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip and allow extra travel time.

Yungblud at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts at 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from Olympic Park.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Festival – Live On Hickson Road

properties.publicTransport: Buses will divert while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Festival – Live On Hickson Road: Efectos Especiales from 5pm to 10pm on Saturday 10 January in the Walsh Bay Arts Precinct.

With large crowds expected, the following changed traffic conditions will be in place on Hickson Rd to safely facilitate the event.

Road closures

  • From 1am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Pottinger St and Towns Pl (south/westbound)
  • From 6am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Towns Pl and Pottinger St (north/eastbound)

Special event clearway parking restrictions will

  • From 1am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Pottinger St and Towns Pl (southern side and centre island)
  • From 6am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Towns Pl and Pottinger St (northern side and centre island)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Motorists should expect traffic delays in the area while closures are in place. Follow the direction of traffic control, allow extra travel time and watch out for increased pedestrian activity in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
Traffic controllers will manage access at the following locations:

Pottinger Street at Windmill Street

  • For vehicles requiring access to Hickson Road northbound and George Street. This includes Pier One Sydney Harbour and Park Hyatt Sydney guests, business deliveries, and residential access.
  • All vehicles will exit via George Street southbound.

Wilson Parking - Bond One Car Park

  • Managed access during operating hours, from 6am to midnight on Saturday 10 January 2026.

Plan your trip

properties.publicTransport:
The free "Gong Shuttle" bus (routes 55A and 55C) will run every 10 minutes until 11pm on New Years Eve, in a loop around Wollongong making stops at North Wollongong Station, Fairy Meadow Station, Gywneville and Wollongong University and Innovation Campus. 

Due to road closures between 4-10pm the Free Shuttle Bus will travel along Corrimal Street instead of Cliff Road.

The closest bus stops to the celebrations at Belmore Basin are along Corrimal St and Burelli St.

From 7pm until 10pm buses that usually run along Crown St and Burelli St will terminate and depart at Burelli St (west of Corrimal St).

There will be an uplift in train services on the South Coast line following the conclusion of the event, selected train services will also run as 8 car services to get passengers to and from the event.
properties.otherAdvice:
25,000 are expected to attend the Wollongong NYE Fireworks this year and family carnival at Lang Park.

The following road closures will be in place from 4pm until 10pm:

  • Cliff Road, between Marine Drive and Georges Place
  • Harbour Street, between Market Street and Cliff Road
  • Hector Street
  • Hinton Street
  • Campbell Street, from Corrimal Street to Wilson Street
  • Wilson Street
  • Smith Street, between Corrimal Street and Harbour Street
  • Market Place
  • Marine Drive 
  • Endeavour Drive

The following road closures will be in place from 8pm until 10pm:

  • Crown Street from Harbour Street to Marine Drive.

Motorists should plan ahead as parking and roads can get busy on New Years Eve. The Innovation Campus car park off Squires Way can be used as a park and ride option by using the Free Gong Shuttle Bus.

properties.publicTransport: Trackwork is taking place on Tuesday 30 December and Sunday 11 January that will affect how you travel to Olympic Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

  • Monday 5 January: Sydney Kings v S.E. Melbourne Phoenix. WNBL match from 5pm. NBL tip off at 7.30pm, full time around 9.30pm.
  • Sunday 11 January: Sydney Kings v Melbourne United. Tip off at 4.30pm, full time around 6.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans make their way to and from Olympic Park, particularly during peak travel times and while other events are on in the precinct.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the Christmas and New Year holiday period between 22 Dec and 26 Jan.

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access.

Walking trails may also be closed due to total fire bans and/or risks, so plan ahead. 

Roads or car parks may close within the Royal National Park when they reach capacity.

The following locations may be affected:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach car park
  • Bonnie Vale day use area
  • Garie Road between Sir Bertram Stevens Drive and Garie Beach car park
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will manage access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr.

For details about known holiday traffic pinch points, see the NSW Holiday and Journey planning website and the pinch point journey planning tool.
